net.jodah.failsafe

Class CircuitBreaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jodah.failsafe.CircuitBreaker

  • public class CircuitBreaker
extends Object
    A circuit breaker that temporarily halts execution when configurable thresholds are exceeded.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CircuitBreaker.State
      The state of the circuit.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CircuitBreaker()
      Creates a Circuit that opens after a single failure, closes after a single success, and has no delay.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      • failOn

        public CircuitBreaker failOn(Class<? extends Throwable>... failures)
        Specifies the types to fail on. Applies to any type that is assignable from the failures.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if failures is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if failures is empty

        public Duration getDelay()
        Returns the delay before allowing another execution on the circuit. Defaults to Duration.NONE.
        See Also:

      • getFailureThreshold

        public Integer getFailureThreshold()
        Returns the number of successive failures that must occur when in a closed state in order to open the circuit else null if none has been configured.
        See Also:
        withFailureThreshold(int)

      • withDelay

        public CircuitBreaker withDelay(long delay,
                                TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the delay to wait in open state before transitioning to half-open.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if delay <= 0

      • withFailureThreshold

        public CircuitBreaker withFailureThreshold(int failureThreshold)
        Sets the number of successive failures that must occur when in a closed state in order to open the circuit. 0 represents no threshold.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if failureThresh < 1
        IllegalStateException - if a failure ratio has already been configured via withFailureThreshold(int, int)

      • withFailureThreshold

        public CircuitBreaker withFailureThreshold(int failures,
                                           int executions)
        Sets the ratio of successive failures that must occur when in a closed state in order to open the circuit. For example: 5, 10 would open the circuit if 5 out of the last 10 executions result in a failure. The circuit will not be opened until at least executions executions have taken place.
        Parameters:
        failures - The number of failures that must occur in order to open the circuit
        executions - The number of executions to measure the failures against
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if failures < 1, executions < 1, or failures is < executions
        IllegalStateException - if a failure ratio has already been configured via withFailureThreshold(int)

      • withSuccessThreshold

        public CircuitBreaker withSuccessThreshold(int successThreshold)
        Sets the number of successive successful executions that must occur when in a half-open state in order to close the circuit. 0 represents no threshold.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if successThreshold < 1
        IllegalStateException - if a success ratio has already been configured via withSuccessThreshold(int, int)

      • withSuccessThreshold

        public CircuitBreaker withSuccessThreshold(int successes,
                                           int executions)
        Sets the ratio of successive successful executions that must occur when in a half-open state in order to close the circuit. For example: 5, 10 would close the circuit if 5 out of the last 10 executions were successful. The circuit will not be closed until at least executions executions have taken place.
        Parameters:
        successes - The number of successful executions that must occur in order to open the circuit
        executions - The number of executions to measure the successes against
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if successes < 1, executions < 1, or successes is < executions
        IllegalStateException - if a success threshold has already been configured via withSuccessThreshold(int)

      • withTimeout

        public CircuitBreaker withTimeout(long timeout,
                                  TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Sets the timeout for executions. Executions that exceed this timeout are recorded as failures.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeUnit is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if timeout <= 0
